Finally, the values used in the input was obtained through self report and therefore may contain errors or misquoted values which might affect the outcome of the predictions. So please consider this while interpreting the results. Please use the predicted probability carefully and responsibly keeping in mind the limitations discussed above. And most importantly, take care of yourself! Remember prevention is better than cure! Consult a Doctor for further assistance and advice. There are many things outside of genetics that contribute to cardiovascular outcomes such as diet and exercise which we currently don't capture so its also important to keep those in mind when making lifestyle choices. The more data points you give me, the better the prediction will be. For example, knowing resting Heart Rate (HR) , HR recovery post exercise and peak HR reached during exercise will significantly improve the accuracy of the predication for presence or absence of CAD. Additionally, we have assumed that age is a continuous variable. But sometimes people may report

prompt.content: You are an AI tasked with predicting whether patients are likely to have heart disease. You will be given a description of the patient with relevant medical signals. Respond with only a 1 to signify if the patient is likely to have heart disease, or a 0 if the patient is not likely to have heart disease. Do not respond with any text or disclaimers, only respond with either 1 or 0.

Age: 49 years, Sex: Female, Chest pain type: Non-Anginal Pain, Resting blood pressure: 160 mm Hg, Serum cholesterol: 180 mg/dl, Fasting blood sugar: <= 120 mg/dl, Resting ECG results: Normal, Max heart rate achieved: 156, Exercise induced angina: No, Oldpeak: 1, ST Slope: Flat
